title: C&C 26 Wave
text:
The C&C 26 Wave is a Canadian <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a>, that was designed by C&C designer <a href="Robert%20W.%20Ball">Robert W. Ball</a> and first built in 1988.
The boat was built by <a href="C%26amp%3BC%20Yachts">C&C Yachts</a> in <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, but it is now out of production.
Despite its name, the C&C 26 Wave is a development of the <a href="C%26amp%3BC%2027%20Mark%20V">C&C 27 Mark V</a> and not the <a href="C%26amp%3BC%2026">C&C 26</a>.
Design.
The C&C 26 Wave is a small recreational <a href="keelboat">keelboat</a>, built predominantly of <a href="fiberglass">fiberglass</a>, with wood trim. It has a <a href="masthead%20sloop">masthead sloop</a> rig, a transom-hung <a href="rudder">rudder</a> and a fixed <a href="wing%20keel">wing keel</a>. It displaces and carries of iron ballast.
The boat has a draft of with the standard wing keel fitted. The boat is fitted with a Universal M-12 <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>.
The design has a <a href="Performance%20Handicap%20Racing%20Fleet">PHRF</a> racing average handicap of 219 with a high of 231 and low of 210. It has a <a href="hull%20speed">hull speed</a> of .
